Pre-Game Insights: Namibia will host Zimbabwe behind closed doors at Orlando Stadium in Johannesburg due to financial challenges, limiting Zimbabwean fan support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played behind closed doors due to Namibia's financial struggles, and the Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) spokesperson confirmed that no fans were allowed for either team.
Others: This decision could be a strategic ploy by Namibia to hinder the Warriors from receiving overwhelming support from millions of Zimbabweans that are currently residing in South Africa.
Similar Tactics: A similar tactic was employed by the Warriors rivals, Bafana Bafana in June, who opted to host their World Cup qualifier against Zimbabwe at Free State Stadium in Bloemfontein, a city with a smaller Zimbabwean population as compared to Johannesburg.
Future Match: The Warriors will have the opportunity to play in front of their fans in the return leg against Namibia on Monday.
Ticket Price: ZIFA set the ticket price for the general public at R50 for the match.
